poem:
Title: "The Jazz of Karting"

'Mid pixels and pastiche, an Oklahoma band,
Swinging on the eye of a mushroom land.
Melodies merging with the roar of carts,
Tapping riffs in tandem with racing hearts.
Through SNES, to N64, the jazz notes twist,
In drifting echoes of a pixelated mist.
Oh, listen - the trumpet's blooper-whispered tune,
A jazz-kart journey, under a digital moon.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Ever wanted to play Mario Kart accompanied by a live jazz band? In Oklahoma, you can Video game soundtracks don’t come more iconic than Mario Kart. As the characters, circuits and power-ups have evolved from the Super Nintendo Entertainment System(SNES) to the N64, Wii and Switch, so has the music. Each new interpretation comes with the familiar melodies from earlier Mario Karts alongside new tunes. What could enhance the experience further than having a live". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
